## Conversation that answers the provided questions:
**User:**
Hi! I'm still learning about Verus and its currency definitions. Can you help me understand what the "systemid" field is for?

**AI Assistant:**
The "systemid" field specifies the system on which the currency is considered to run. It is a string representing the ID of the system. Does that make sense?

**User:**
Yeah, that's clear. What about the "launchsystemid" field? What does that represent?

**AI Assistant:**
The "launchsystemid" field represents the system from which the currency was launched. It is a string representing the ID of the launching system. Got it?

**User:**
I think so. What about the "startblock" and "endblock" fields? What do they do?

**AI Assistant:**
The "startblock" field represents the block number on the chain that must be notarized into block one of the chain, while the "endblock" field represents the block number after which the chain's useful life is considered to be over. Both are integers. Do you have any more questions about those?

**User:**
No, that's clear. What about the "weights" field? When is it returned?

**AI Assistant:**
The "weights" field represents the relative currency weights and is only returned for a liquidity basket. It is an array of numbers. Does that make sense in the context of liquidity baskets?

**User:**
Yeah, I think so. What about the "conversions" and "minpreconversion" fields? What do they represent?

**AI Assistant:**
The "conversions" field represents the pre-launch conversion rates for non-fractional currencies, while the "minpreconversion" field represents the minimum amounts required in pre-conversions for the currency to launch. Both are arrays of numbers. Do you have any more questions about those?

**User:**
No, that's clear. What is the purpose of the "currencies" field?

**AI Assistant:**
The "currencies" field lists the currencies that can be converted to this currency at launch or make up a liquidity basket. It is an array of strings representing the IDs of the currencies. Got it?

**User:**
Yeah. Finally, what does the "currencynames" field represent?

**AI Assistant:**
The "currencynames" field is an object that maps i-addresses to fully qualified names of all sub-currencies. Does that make sense?
AI Assistant
N/A
What is the purpose of the "systemid" field in a currency definition?
The "systemid" field specifies the system on which the currency is considered to run. It is a string representing the ID of the system.

s",        (string) parent blockchain ID
  "systemid" : "i-address",       (string) system on which this currency is considered to run
  "launchsystemid" : "i-address",    (string) system from which this currency was launched
  "notarizationprotocol" : n       (int) protocol number that determines variations in cross-chain or bridged notarizations
  "proofprotocol" : n          (int) protocol number that determines variations in cross-chain or bridged proofs
  "startblock" : n,           (int) block # on this chain, which must be notarized into block one of the chain
  "endblock" : n,            (int) block # after which, this chain's useful life is considered to be over
  "weights" : "[n, ...]",        (numberarray) relative currency weights (only returned for a liquidity basket)
  "conversions" : "[n, ...]",      (numberarray) pre-launch conversion rates for non-fractional currencies
  "minpreconversion" : "[n, ...]",    (numberarray) minimum amounts required in pre-conversions for currency to launch
  "currencies" : "["i-address", ...]",  (stringarray) currencies that can be converted to this currency at launch or makeup a liquidity basket
  "currencynames" : "{"i-address":"fullname",...}", (obj) i-addresses mapped to fully qualified names of all sub-currencies
  "initialsupply" : n,          (number) initial currency supply for fractional currencies before preallocation or issuance
  "prelaunchcarveout" : n,        (number) pre-launch percentage of proceeds for fractional currency sent to launching ID
  "preallocations" : "[{"i-address":n}, ...]", (objarray) VerusIDs and amounts for pre-allocation at launch
  "initialcontributions" : "[n, ...]",  (numberarray) amounts of pre-conversions reserved for launching ID
  "idregistrationfees" : n,
./raw_text_input_wiki/clifaq-02_verus_commands.md

What do the "startblock" and "endblock" fields in a currency definition represent?

The "startblock" field represents the block number on the chain that must be notarized into block one of the chain, while the "endblock" field represents the block number after which the chain's useful life is considered to be over. Both are integers.

What do the "conversions" and "minpreconversion" fields in a currency definition represent?

The "conversions" field represents the pre-launch conversion rates for non-fractional currencies, while the "minpreconversion" field represents the minimum amounts required in pre-conversions for the currency to launch. Both are arrays of numbers.

  "systemid" : "i-address",       (string) system on which this currency is considered to run
  "launchsystemid" : "i-address",    (string) system from which this currency was launched
  "notarizationprotocol" : n       (int) protocol number that determines variations in cross-chain or bridged notarizations
  "proofprotocol" : n          (int) protocol number that determines variations in cross-chain or bridged proofs
  "startblock" : n,           (int) block # on this chain, which must be notarized into block one of the chain
  "endblock" : n,            (int) block # after which, this chain's useful life is considered to be over
